alert.note: Alert for Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Nolan County through 345 PM CDT... At 306 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, or near Nolan, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roscoe, Nolan, Maryneal, Champion, The Intersection Of Highway 70 And Ranch Road 53, Lake Sweetwater, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 608 And Highway 147, Camp Boothe Oaks and I-20 Near The Nolan-Mitchell County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 229 and 237. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
